other_tests.findings: Decreased cortisol inactivation, urinary tetrahydrocortisol and tetrahydrocortisone ratio (THF/THF)/THE ranging from 2.4 to 40, and nearly absent urinary free cortisone in all but one case.

Distinct homozygous point mutations in four families, a compound heterozygous mutation in one family, and a large 23-bp exonic insert with frameshift and disruption of the amino acid sequence in another family.
Low plasma renin and low aldosterone levels in affected individuals, indicating mineralocorticoid hypertension.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment with dexamethasone and spironolactone resulted in normalization of BP in some cases, maintaining these improvements over time.

other_tests.findings: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) in some individuals.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Resolved in some cases after treatment.
